intro: Planodes mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican planodes, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their showy flowers and often toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, although it requires careful handling due to its toxic sap.
